TopicTitle: A question to devs about regional pricing

Articles.Content:
I only have one question, that's why I signed up here. Will you fix the regional pricing for Turkey?

My son and I are waiting to hear about this, because this will determine weather we buy this game or not. Thank you.

Edited February 24, 2023 by consiefe

I am having the same issue as someone from Turkey.

Here is a quote from steam comments:

Quote

It's not even just Turkey,

South Africa, Taiwan, South Asia -Usd (Pakistan), and CIS countries (ex-Soviet states), are all left with over +%100 increase from Valve's suggested regional pricing.

While Argentine, Colombia, China, Peru, Brazil and Chile all get Valve-suggested regional prices.

This is outright discrimination.
Either make the price 50 US dollars for the entire planet or make the regional pricing available for everyone.

[Snip]

When I had problems with take 2 in the past I sent them an email and they did respond after a few days.  So I think you  can very well get a response, at least with the official explanation of their local pricing policies.

I sent the following mail and pasting it here for information. 
 
Quote
About Your Regional Pricing Policy on KSP2
Hello, 
 
I was wondering if you made a mistake or forgot to change the regional pricing of KSP2 for Turkey? 
 
Lots of players here, including me and my six year old son were looking forwards the sequel of our beloved game. But while you were employing regional prices for some of the countries, you didn't do it for  the others including Turkey. This practice blocks us from getting the game as this price tag is way too much for us in our country. I also want to stream this game on my Youtube channel, but I can not buy the game with the current price.
 
I request action on your behalf and hope that you adjust the price of the game for us. Please inform me about this matter.
 
Respectfully

Me and many many other Turkish KSP fans sent e-mails to taketwo. It's been over a week now. As I suspected no one got any response. We are existing guys and we want to play your game as well. As of late I heard that you adjusted Mexico prices to a reasonable degree from what I read on Steam forums.  That means there are even less countries in which you are holding off applying the regional prices. Please hear us, we are veteren KSP players and we want to experience this sequel too.
